general_advisory: Because of the low pressure, rainfall activities may continue at isolated places of Keonjhar. Farmers are advised to remove excess water from the field. Make a watch on paddy field to maintain a water level of 2-3 cm. Insecticides and pesticides spray can be resumed when no rainfall occurs. Monitor the field for pest attacks.

advisory: Make bunds to store water in the field.
Maintain a water level of 2-3 cm in the field.
Regularly check out for any disease and pest attack.
Take immediate action to prevent the below given pest infestation.
Remove excess water from the field.
Harvest the matured fruits and sell them at nearby market at good price.
For managing aphids and other sucking bugs, spray Imidachloprid 17.8% SL @ 2 ml/lt.
Protect the maize crop from monkeys by providing barbed wire fencing.
Harvest the matured pods and keep them at safe and dry places.
Dry it under the sun to reduce its moisture percentage.
To reduce the sucking bug insects attack, spray Progress Plus (Profenophos+Cypermethrin) @ 40 ml/15lt.
To reduce the infestation of pod borer in green gram and blackgram crop, apply flubendi amide 20% @ 150 g or Chlorantrinilipole 0.4% G @ 10 g in 500 litres of water per hectare.
Keep some gunny bag or polythene under the fruits and allow it to grow on it.
Protect the fruit from rainfall damage.
Make drainage to remove excess water.
Alternaria leaf blight can be managed by spraying Carbendazim or Mancozeb @ 2 g/lt.
Remove the weeds growing near the plants.
Hadda beetle may cause leaf scrapping and defoliation of it. Spray Carbaryl 50 WP @ 3 g/lt.
To control fruit fly infestation spray Endosulphan @ 6 ml/4.5 lt.
For managing aphid population, spray with Malathion @ 1ml/lt or Metasystox @ 2 ml/lt.
Harvest the matured fruit and keep them at safe places.
Yellow vein mosaic virus may spread through whitefly. To manage it, spray Quinalphos 25EC @ 2 lt/ha.
Fruit and shoot borer can be controlled by spraying Emamectin benzoate @ 4g/10 lt.
Keep the field weed free.
Sell the matured fruits at market at suitable prices.
Papaya plant is sensitive to water stagnation. Therefore, remove excess water from the root zone.
Add or apply vermicompost to the soil for better nutrient availability.
To control White fly, spray Malathion @ 1 ml/lt or Metasystox @ 2 ml/lt.
Do not grow cucurbits near to the papaya crop cultivation.
Papaya ring spot virus may spread through aphids. Spray Imidachloprid 17.8% SL @ 1-2 ml/lt to manage the disease.
Use of Chloropyriphos or Carbofuran 3G will help to kill the ants and larva of the pests.
For managing yellow sigatoka disease in banana spray Propiconazole @ 0.1% on the leaves.
Bird Flu cases are rising in Odisha state at an alarming rate.
Keep watch on the birds.
Birds will have the symptoms of watery eyes, diarrhea, nasal discharge and ultimately death.
Kill the birds which are infected and separate and bury them away from the flock.
